title: What is Boston, Massachusetts known for? - Quora

response.answer_text: Boston is best known as the birthplace of the American Revolution. It is also known as the home of the Adams family (actually Quincy just to the south of Boston, but part of the Greater Boston Metro area) — that birthed two presidents, John and his son John Quincy; the first of two first lady/mother of presidents Abigail Adams, and that also birthed the organizer of the American Revolution Sam Adams. Boston is known as the ironic birthplace of religious freedom — as the settlement of the Puritans who escaped persecution in England, and also as the site of great religious intolerance, with the persecution and execution of the Quakers and other religious non-conformists. More recently, Boston is known as the birthplace and home of John Fitzgerald Kennedy, much beloved Senator and president from 1961–1963; and James Michael Curley, beloved champion of Irish immigrants and multi-term mayor of Boston who broke the Yankee stranglehold on the city. For union activists, Boston is known as the site of the Boston Policeman’s strike — and it’s brutal repression by then governor and later president Calvin Coolidge. For sports fans it is known as the city of champions — the long suffering but 21st century successful Boston Red Sox, the greatest football dynasty of all time, the New England Patriots, and the greatest NBA dynasty of all time, the Boston Celtics. Three great boxers are also from the Greater Boston area: Marvelous Marvin Hagler of Easton and Brockton, the only undefeated heavyweight champion Rocky Marciano, of Brockton, and the first heavyweight champion of the modern gloved era, John Sullivan. The mammoth trans-USA interstate highway, Route 90, commences here (or ends here depending on your perspective).
